definitions.definition: including or covering all the services, facilities, or items normally expected or required.
examples: the price is inclusive, with few incidentals

definitions.definition: containing (a specified element) as part of a whole.
examples: all prices are inclusive of taxes

definitions.definition: with the inclusion of the extreme limits stated.
examples: between the ages of 55 and 59 inclusive

definitions.definition: not excluding any section of society or any party involved in something.
examples: only an inclusive peace process will end the conflict

definitions.definition: (of language) deliberately nonsexist, especially avoiding the use of masculine pronouns to refer to both men and women.
